title: Finance Seed diligence checklist
summary: Fintech seed diligence focuses on regulatory positioning, unit economics, and risk management capability. Investors conduct thorough review of compliance infrastructure and banking relationships. Prepare comprehensive documentationâ€”quality reflects operational maturity. Pitchchat keeps diligence docs organized and easy to review.

items.rationale: Complete regulatory assessment: licenses required, current status, applications in progress. Compliance policies and procedures. Legal opinions on regulatory positioning. Compliance counsel relationships.

items.item: Banking partner agreements and relationship documentation
items.rationale: Banking partner contracts and terms. Relationship history and stability indicators. Diversification or backup plans. BaaS provider agreements if applicable.

items.item: Unit economics analysis with cohort data
items.rationale: Detailed CAC breakdown by channel. LTV analysis based on actual customer behavior. Cohort analysis showing economics evolution. Payback period calculation with supporting data.

items.item: Risk management framework and loss data
items.rationale: Fraud prevention approach and vendor stack. Identity verification process. Loss rate data if available. Risk monitoring and early warning indicators. Credit underwriting if applicable.
User metrics: actives, engagement patterns, retention. Transaction data: volume, frequency, value. Customer feedback and NPS data. Customer reference contacts.
System architecture overview. Security framework and certifications. Data protection approach. Vendor dependencies and risks. Scalability assessment.
Revenue model documentation with assumptions. Margin analysis by product/segment. Path to profitability analysis. Scenario modeling for different growth rates.
Competitive landscape mapping. Differentiation documentation. Win/loss analysis if available. Market positioning strategy.
Detailed team backgrounds highlighting financial services experience. Compliance expertise assessment. Key person dependencies. Advisory relationships.
Corporate structure optimized for regulated activity. Pending or threatened litigation. Customer agreements and terms of service. Privacy policy and data handling.
Cyber insurance, E&O coverage, D&O insurance. Coverage limits and exclusions. Fidelity bond if applicable.
Complete cap table. Prior funding terms. Any unusual provisions or structure issues.
